title: Internal Compiler Error

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
I was messing around with boxed closures and stumbled upon this compiler error:

```
src/main.rs:14:9: 14:43 error: internal compiler error: cannot relate bound region: ReScope(DestructionScope(24)) <= ReLateBound(DebruijnIndex { depth: 1 }, BrAnon(0))
src/main.rs:14         Class { methods: BTreeMap::new() }
                       ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box<Any>', /Users/rustbuild/src/rust-buildbot/slave/nightly-dist-rustc-mac/build/src/libsyntax/diagnostic.rs:176
```

With this code:

``` rust
use std::collections::BTreeMap;

pub trait Object {}

pub type Function = Box<Fn(Box<&Object>)>;

pub struct Class {
    pub methods: BTreeMap<String, Function>
}

impl Class {
    pub fn new() -> Class {
        Class { methods: BTreeMap::new() }
    }
}
```
## Meta

```
rustc 1.2.0-nightly (c6b148337 2015-06-12)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: c6b14833771d0254d189b368b5ab41b295e02fd1
commit-date: 2015-06-12
host: x86_64-apple-darwin
release: 1.2.0-nightly
```
